alert.note: Alert for Lipscomb; Ochiltree (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 9:05PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Lipscomb and southern Ochiltree Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 905 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Farnsworth, or 10 miles south of Perryton, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wolf Creek Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
